content.description: Climb the face right of the crack, but left of the bolted line In To Deep.
content.protection: TR from a 2 bolt anchor with chains or clip the newly installed bolts along Weeping Crack.

content.description:
The large wall on the way into the Main Wall Grotto.  Follow the left side crack system, using pro to 5" to gain access to the TR chains above or clip the newly installed bots as of 09/2015.

Bolts installed due to the brittle nature of The Shredding's limestone.  Most climbers tend to avoid trad pro leads here, due to the tendency of the rock to break, causing trad gear to pull.
content.protection:
4- 3.5" Fixe Glue ins.

2- expansion bolt anchor with Mailllons and plated chain.

content.description: The first crux is low between the 1st and 2nd bolt with a few hard moves of 5.9-5.10 higher up.  Well protected throughout the climb, with bolts right where they need to be.
content.protection:
6- 3.5" 5 piece Powers Bolts with Fixe hangers.

Finishes at a comfortable stance with a 2 bolt anchor equipped with plated chain and quick links for the lower off.
content.location:
In the north grotto, behind and north of the route Right Field.

Top rope access can be reached by scrambling northwest around the grotto.  A protection bolt has been placed to safely access the top rope anchors.  The top rope anchors are a bit exposed, best to clip the bolt for access.

Either lower off anchor chains or walk off at the top and scramble back around and down into the north grotto.

content.description: Opposite Green Monster on the right wall of the corridor
content.protection: Gear to 2" for TR, pads and long slings

content.description: This route climbs the visible spire seen from the area of the Main Wall.
content.protection:
Access TR by scrambling up the short 3rd class gully left of the spire. This scramble will also access the North Grotto.

Lead bolts appear to have been added as of 2020.
content.location: This route is the furthest route east of all the Back Wall Routes, but will be encountered before Swallow Hole.

content.description: start up God Delusion for one bolt and continue direct up the blank wall

in The cave R of Right field. Start on low undercut and bust out R via big moves on big holds to top out at the tree. Probably been done before (?Travis) as some holds had been "comfortised" like his routes on the main wall.

The left hand exit from the inital pistol grip is V4

The route begins from the large block at the base. Its best to have your belayer give you a good spot before the first bolt due to the nasty pit below or better yet use a stick clip to avoid the exposure.

The initial moves from the ground are the first crux.  Once the first bolt is clipped, pull a second crux and clip the 2nd bolt. The route flows up the arete feature, at the 3rd bolt pull a layback along a corner to avoid the blank section to reach a few jugs above.
content.protection:
5- 3/8"x3.5" Powers 5 piece bolts with grey camouflaged plated Fixe hangers.

2- 1/2"x3.5" Powers 5 piece bolts with Fixe plated hangers and 4- 3/8" Maillons for lower offs.
content.location:
Follow directions to locate the route Swallow Hole.

This route is found in the North Grotto and is directly left of Swallow hole.

content.description: Start right of Sittin' Pretty and climb the clean pockets and edges along a smooth white streak of stone.
content.protection: Gear to 2", pads and long slings for the TR

content.description:
Start this route at the obvious weakness between The Weeping Crack and the bolts of Dread the Shred (furthest right bolts).

The route follows the Orange striped weakness through easy 5.6-5.8 terrain past 3 bolts. Once the 4th bolt is clipped the harder moves begin. Climb through a V3 sequence of 7 strenuous moves with tricky feet to clip the chains.
content.protection:
5 3/8"x3" Powers Bolts with Fixe hangers

2 bolt anchor with 3.5"x 3/8" Powers Bolts fixed with 5/8" plated chain and 5/8" quick links

An additional 3/8"x3" Powers Bolt w/ Fixe hanger was added above the anchor to allow for safe access for setting up a top rope on In To Deep and Dread the Shred.
content.location: Between Weeping Wall and Dread The Shred

content.description: On the backside of the Main Wall in the narrow corridor.  Dirty TR route that follows a vigorously cleaned swath of stone 20 feet to the anchors
content.protection: If you really want to try this, bring gear to 3", long slings and pads to protect your rope from the sharp edges.

content.description: L of Weeping crack in the bay behind Main wall

This route was bolted as a project in the 90's and has never seen a known first ascent.  Its rumored to go at a hard 5.12+.

This route is the furthest right bolted line on the Weeping Wall.  Follow small edges to a sharp finger crack, back out to the face for more small crimps, passing a total of 4 bolts, ending at a 2 bolt anchor with quick links.
content.protection:
A lower new 3/8" bolt with Petzl hanger was added as a first bolt to protect the lower entry crux off the ground, which leads to 3 older bolts with SMC hangers and a 2 bolt anchor with closed cold shuts and quick links.  Equipped with and older single protection bolt on the top of the route for reaching the TR anchors.

Update:  An additional new 3/8"x3.5" Powers Bolt and Fixe hanger was added next to the single older bolt to allow for safer access to Dread the Shred and In To Deep.

content.description:
You know that pillar that you have looked at a bunch of times and wondered how fun it would be to climb it? Well wonder no longer! The West face is bolted and it's harder than it looks. Sustained and reachy movements up slopey ledges and crimps. It's over too early.

A nice breeze blows through the gully by the climb and it stays shaded til the afternoon.

Heads up on the second bolt. It's a reachy clip and if you botch it, you may deck.
content.protection: 4 bolts to 2 bolts anchor with quicklinks to rap.
content.location: On the pillar on the right side of the weeping wall.
